description: Defense wrapped up closing arguments today in the Sean “Diddy” Combs trial. Combs is charged with sex trafficking and racketeering, and could face life in prison if convicted. NBC News’ Chloe Melas, who was inside the courtroom today, reports on the very latest.
title: Jury to start deliberating Monday in the Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial

author: Daniel Arkin
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: In closing arguments, Diddy lawyer says Cassie relationship was a 'great modern love story'

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: The dismissals were the first time that prosecutors who worked on Jan. 6 cases and were past their probationary period of federal employment had been fired by the Justice Department.
title: Pam Bondi fires two Jan. 6 prosecutors, sending another chill through DOJ workforce

author: Tim Stelloh
description: An inmate who escaped from the New Orleans city jail in May and was on the run for more than a month has been captured, authorities said Friday
title: Orleans Parish jail inmate is captured after more than a month on the run

author: The Politics Desk
description: In today’s edition, our legal team breaks down what comes next after the Supreme Court’s major ruling in the birthright citizenship case.
title: What comes next after the Supreme Court's birthright citizenship ruling: From the Politics Desk

author: Reuters
description: U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem will end deportation protections for half a million Haitians, the latest move by the Trump administration to strip migrants of legal status as it ramps up deportations
title: Trump administration to end deportation relief for Haitians in the U.S.

author: Jonathan Allen
description: President Donald Trump is on the verge of getting billions of dollars from Congress to recruit and retain agents to carry out his mass-deportation campaign.
title: Congress set to hand Trump billions to recruit more ICE agents

author: Evan Bush
description: Forecasters are set to lose some of their sharpest eyes in the sky just a few months before Atlantic Hurricane season peaks
title: Deep cuts to hurricane data could leave forecasters in the dark as storm season looms

author: Scott Wong
description: Senate Republican leaders are hoping to start voting on their massive domestic policy bill on Saturday, even as major pieces of it have yet to be finalized.
title: Senate Republicans eye weekend votes on Trump's massive bill as tensions run high

author: Kevin Collier
description: At least two North American airlines have recently been victims of hackers as cybersecurity firms warn that cybercriminals are targeting the aviation industry.
title: North American airlines targeted by cyberattacks

author: David Noriega
description: Even before her son was summarily locked up in a Salvadoran prison and cut off from contact with the outside world, Mariela Villamizar was worried about his health
title: Venezuelan who had rare, major surgery was deported to El Salvador prison, and his family has no idea how he is

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: The president of the University of Virginia is resigning following pressure from the Trump administration to step aside amid a Justice Department probe into the school’s diversity practices.
title: University of Virginia president resigns amid Trump admin investigation of diversity initiatives

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — Almost as soon as the Supreme Court released its ruling limiting the ability of judges to block President Donald Trump's plan to end birthright citizenship, challengers brought new legal claims seeking the same result by a different means
title: Supreme Court birthright citizenship ruling sparks new round of legal fights

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: Musician Daniel Hamrick went viral for his performance at the "Hetero Awesome Fest" in Idaho, where he played a song about a transgender boy.
title: LGBTQ musician goes viral after playing protest song at ‘Hetero Awesome Fest’ in Idaho

author: Benjamin Ryan
description: The Supreme Court on Friday granted the HIV-prevention field a historic win — yet with a major caveat — as it upheld a federally appointed health task force’s authority to mandate no-cost insurance coverage of certain preventive interventions, but clarifying that the Health and Human Services secretary holds dominion over the panel.
title: By maintaining Obamacare pillar, Supreme Court hands win to HIV advocates

description: Judge Subramanian said the jury would be charged on Monday and would then begin deliberations. NBC News' Danny Cevallos reports on the deliberations timeline while Rehema Ellis details a new lawsuit against Sean "Diddy" Combs and his son.
title: Judge to give jury instructions on Monday in Sean 'Diddy' Combs sex trafficking case

author: The Associated Press
description: The state is building a compound of heavy-duty tents, trailers and other temporary buildings in the Big Cypress National Preserve, which are ecologically sensitive wetlands.
title: Environmental groups file lawsuit to stop migrant detention center in Florida Everglades

description: A police report shows that several fifth-grade students were arrested for allegedly plotting to kill a fellow classmate and make it look like a suicide. KPNX's Gabriella Bachara reports.
title: Police say Arizona 5th graders plotted to kill classmate

author: Doha Madani
description: A group of fifth-grade students were arrested last fall over an alleged plot to murder a fellow student after being overheard discussing their plans, according to a newly released police report.
title: Arizona 5th graders plotted to murder boy in bathroom and make it look like suicide, police say

author: Rob Wile
description: President Donald Trump said Friday that he had terminated trade discussions with Canada, citing an incoming Canadian tax on tech companies including ones based in the U.S..
title: Trump terminates trade talks with Canada

description: President Donald Trump spoke to reporters after a Supreme Court ruling on injunctions that curbed his birthright citizenship plan. The president called the lower court's ability to issue nationwide injunctions a "grave threat to democracy" and discussed the reasoning behind his planned changes to birthright citizenship.
title: Trump says lower court birthright injunctions were a 'grave threat to democracy'

author: Randee Dawn, TODAY
description: After three seasons, hundreds of deaths, billions of Korean won handed out, and a seemingly infinite rollercoaster of twists and turns, “Squid Game” has now dropped its final episodes on Netflix
title: How does ‘Squid Game’ end? Who wins the final game, Player 456's fate and more, explained

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court upheld a Texas law aimed at restricting young people’s access to pornographic content online.
title: Supreme Court upholds Texas adult website age-verification law

author: Natasha Korecki
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom filed a multimillion-dollar lawsuit agains Fox News on Friday.
title: Gavin Newsom targets Fox News in a $787-million lawsuit

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump holds an event at the Oval Office. This comes after the Supreme Court issued a ruling that curbs the injunctions blocking the president's birthright citizenship plan.
title: Trump holds Oval Office event after Supreme Court rulings

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court rules in favor of parents who objected to LGBTQ-themed books that a Maryland county approved for use in elementary school classrooms.
title: Supreme Court backs parents seeking to opt their kids out of LGBTQ books in elementary schools

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court rejected a challenge to a Federal Communications Commission program that subsidizes phone and internet services in underserved parts of the country.
title: Supreme Court upholds phone and internet subsidy program for underserved areas

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court rejected a challenge to an Affordable Care Act provision that set up a panel to recommend preventive care services that insurers must provide at no cost to patients.
title: Supreme Court endorses Obamacare panel that requires free preventive care

author: Kimmy Yam
description: Iranian university students who planned to study in the United States said that their academic careers have been derailed by the Trump administration’s visa ban on people from their country.
title: Visa bans, U.S. strikes derail future of Iranian students seeking to study in America

description: The Supreme Court has granted a request by the Trump administration to narrow the scope of injunctions imposed by judges that blocked the implementation of the president's birthright citizenship plan. NBC News' Laura Jarrett has details on what the ruling means for Americans and the impact it has on lower court rulings.
title: Supreme Court curbs injunctions blocking Trump birthright citizenship plan

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A 61-year-old youth sports umpire died over the weekend from heat stroke after passing out during a softball tournament in Sumter County, South Carolina.
title: South Carolina youth sports umpire collapses, dies from heat stroke

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Former Minnesota House Speaker Melissa Hortman will lie in the Minnesota Capitol rotunda on Friday as her suspected killer is scheduled to appear in court
title: Minnesota Rep. Melissa Hortman, husband and dog to lie in state as suspected killer is in court

author: Molly Hunter
description: Oprah Winfrey, Kim and Khloe Kardashian, Tom Brady, Bill Gates and Leonardo Di Caprio are among the many already gathered in Venice for the lavish celebrations.
title: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's wedding in Venice kicks off with celebrities and protesters

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Sean "Diddy" Combs' son, Justin Combs, has been accused in a new lawsuit of luring a woman from Louisiana to Los Angeles, where she was allegedly gang-raped by his father and two other masked men
title: Diddy and his son Justin accused of luring woman to L.A. where she was allegedly gang raped

author: Rob Wile
description: The S&P 500 has just set an all-time high — and essentially returned to where it began shortly after the start of President Donald Trump’s second term
title: S&P 500 returns to all-time high — right where it started at the outset of Trump's second term

author: Reuters
description: After Israeli and American forces struck Iranian nuclear targets, officials in both countries sounded the alarm over potentially disruptive cyberattacks carried out by the Islamic Republic’s hackers.
title: Iran's hackers keep a low profile after Israeli and US strikes

description: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez kicked off Day 2 of their Italian wedding extravaganza with A-Listers including Bill Gates, Oprah, Tom Brady, Ivanaka Trump and Jared Kushner. NBC’s Molly Hunter reports for TODAY from Venice.
title: See Some of the Celebs at Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sánchez Wedding

description: Trump administration officials are holding a closed briefing with House members this morning on the U.S. strikes on Iran's nuclear enrichment facilities last weekend.
title: House to receive classified briefing on Iran strikes

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: The Supreme Court will mark its final day with rulings on several cases, including the birthright citizenship dispute.
title: Supreme Court set to make rulings and CDC vaccine committee meeting: Morning Rundown

author: Patrick Smith
description: The family of a 32-year-old U.S. citizen said she was wrongfully detained by ICE officers and falsely accused of "forcefully obstructing" officers during an immigration raid in downtown Los Angeles.
title: ICE detained a U.S. citizen in L.A. and charged her with obstructing an arrest

author: The Associated Press
description: An Israeli strike hit a street in central Gaza on Thursday where witnesses said a crowd of people was getting bags of flour from a Palestinian police unit that had confiscated the goods from gangs looting aid convoys.
title: An Israeli strike kills 18 Palestinians in central Gaza as turmoil mounts over food distribution

author: Reuters
description: China‘s top legislature has voted to remove senior military official Miao Hua from the Central Military Commission, its highest-level military command body, state media said.
title: China purges senior military official Miao Hua from top ruling body

author: The Associated Press
description: Six Americans were detained Friday in South Korea for trying to send 1,600 plastic bottles filled with rice, U.S. dollars bills and Bibles toward North Korea by sea, police said.
title: 6 Americans detained for trying to send rice and Bibles to North Korea by sea, police say

author: Dan De Luce
description: A top Republican senator is proposing a 60% cut in the spy agency led by Tulsi Gabbard as she appears to have fallen out of favor in the Trump administration.
title: Republican senators propose slashing size of intel office led by Tulsi Gabbard

author: Dylan Ebs
description: Democrats vying to succeed the late Rep.
title: Virginia Democrats target Trump in race to replace Gerry Connolly in Congress

author: The Associated Press
description: Lalo Schifrin, the composer who wrote the endlessly catchy theme for "Mission: Impossible" and more than 100 other arrangements for film and television, died Thursday.
title: Lalo Schifrin, composer of the 'Mission: Impossible' theme, dies at 93

author: The Associated Press
description: Two smugglers convicted of federal charges in connection with the deaths of 53 migrants found in the back of a sweltering tractor-trailer in Texas in 2022 face up to life in prison when they are scheduled to be sentenced Friday.
title: Smugglers to be sentenced in 53 migrant deaths from 2022 human smuggling tragedy in Texas

author: The Associated Press
description: A Colorado funeral home owner is set to be sentenced Friday for cheating customers and defrauding the government out of nearly $900,000 in COVID-19 aid.
title: Colorado funeral home owner accused of stashing nearly 190 bodies to be sentenced for fraud

author: Reuters
description: Japan executed a man on Friday who killed nine people after contacting them on social media, the first use of capital punishment in the country in nearly three years.
title: Japan hangs 'Twitter killer' in first execution since 2022

author: The Associated Press
description: The number of Kenyans who died during Wednesday’s nationwide protests over police brutality and bad governance has doubled to 16, according to the state-funded human rights commission.
title: Death toll from Kenya’s anti-government protests rises to 16

author: Zoë Richards
description: Chesebro in 2023 pleaded guilty to one count of conspiracy to commit filing false documents in the Georgia election interference case against Trump and his allies.
title: Former Trump lawyer Kenneth Chesebro disbarred in New York over 2020 election interference case
